text: [Music]
hello i'm sandeep a database
administrator here at the aws office in
dallas
today i'm going to show you what is
consuming storage on an amazon
relational database services sql server
let's get started
after logging into aws management
console navigate to the rds console
then select the rds sql server instance
and navigate to monitoring
here you can see free storage space
however this metric does not show us
what's consuming the space on the sql
server instance
to find out what's consuming the space
on your sql server instance
let's connect to this amazon rds
endpoint using ssms
next we can run this query to give us
the information about physical disk
space usage
the results showing the 10 db size don't
reflect the current size of that mdb
instead it shows us the startup size of
the 10db let's run this query to check
the current size of the term db
next you can break down the total size
used by an individual database by
running this query
to determine the amount of storage used
by transaction locks run this query
if the tem db is consuming a large
amount of available storage you can
shrink the 10db database
to learn more see the strength that mdb
database documentation link in the
associated knowledge center article
if you enable amazon simple storage
service and trace files that can also
consume space on the desk
to see space occupied by files on desk
you can run this query to list the files
on the disk
this will display the task id you can
then run this query to get the size of
the files on the desk
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at aws
[Music]
